name: 1 - Prepare Erosion & sediment Control Plan (ESCP) for the Works Under the deed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The ESCP will form part of the EMP and will be incorporated in the ERA.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installed in accordance to the approved progressive ESCP and guided by the BLUE BOOK.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As indicated on design drawing
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Notification that set out of drainage system has been completed. The Nominated Authority will inspect the set out prior to authorising the release of the Hold Point.
○ Set out the location and level of open drains as shown on the Design Drawings.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Excavate to dimensions shown on drawings.
○ Where dimensions are not shown, excavate to:
— Extend open drains as necessary to natural drainage depressions or to a drainage system.
4 - Construction of open drains with grade less than 1%.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Notification that 1% minimum grade cannot be achieved.
○ The PV will consider the matter, and will direct you further, prior to authorising the release of the Hold Point.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Notification to the PV that inadequate foundation material has been excavated to the extent required.
○ Replace inadequate foundation material with materials from cuttings, or with other conforming material, and compact to the requirements of Clause 4.9.2 of this Specification.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Trim open drains to produce a uniform surface free of irregularities.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Establish Pegs (or equivalent) to identify the extend of filling
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Design DWGs, Survey Management Plan
3 - Verify conformance of select fill material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Imported Select Fill Material: CBR15
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP, Material spec report
5 - Place, spread fill material (parallel to the grade), compact and test to specified densities
○ Maximum layer thickness after compaction <= 150mm unless otherwise approved
○ Ensure insitu sampling and testing for compaction conformity is undertaken in accordance with TfNSW Q6 Annexure L
6 - For hill side embankment foundation, terrace 1m wide of the hill side of embankment and ensure its free draining
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Minimum Step Depth || Slope
7 - Conduct Deflection Testing – Proof rolling Method within 1.5m underside of SMZ
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Must not exhibit deformation, yielding and/or show signs of distress or instability.
○ All embankment layers and other surface within 1.5m of underside of SMZ
○ With refer to RFI 436: Clause 3, Note B on T198 states that other equipment may be used,

R71-UCP-IPT-Unbound Pavement Course - Public Roads Upgrade
template name: R71-UCP-IPT-Unbound Pavement Course - Public Roads Upgrade

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Establish Pegs (or equivalent) to identify the extent of pavement
3 - Check underlying lots are conforming and closed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check underlying drainage and earthwork lots are conforming and closed, Hold Points released
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Verify material meets the requirements of R71 and D&C 3051. Attach NATA endorsed test results to the statement, indicate the quantity of material represented by the test results.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The material must be slightly damp and at the time of delivery
○ Check delivery docket to ensure correct materials supplied
8 - Placing, spreading, compaction and trimming the material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Maintain field moisture content during placement and compaction within the target moisture content envelope
○ For modified (sub)base, complete the construction within the Allowable Working Time
○ No roller marks left after final trimming
○ No delivery traffic allowed on the placed
○ Trim the pavement course to design level
○ Moisture content ≤70% of OMC prior to seal – as relative compaction frequency
○ Level within -0/+10mm (base), or -10/+0mm (subbase) - 1 per 20 linear metres, offset as per table G71.7
○ Layer thickness within -0/+20mm (base), or -/+10mm (subbase) – at least one site per 75m, with a minimum of 2 per lot
○ Pavement width ≥ design width – minimum 1 per 20 linear metres.
○ Unconfined compressive strength is less than 1 MPa (accordance with T116)
○ Minimum frequency of testing (T116 one pair per 400 tonnes or part thereof)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD: T116, T173, T166
10 - Obtain approval for sealing of the pavement
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Submit to the Project Verifier with test results of above pavement properties
11 - Carry out base course surface assessment
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The average ball penetration value of a sample location (Pes) is ≤ 3.0 mm; and the characteristic ball penetration value is ≤ 2.5 mm.
12 - Obtain approval of treatment of non-conforming lots
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Submit to the Project Verifier a NCR and details of proposal to rectify or replace the Lot, prior to carry out the rectification works
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

name: 2 - Confirm the type of asphalt seal to be laid against the design drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The type and thickness of asphalt are proposed as per the details shown on pavement design drawings
— To be delivered into the paver between 120C-165C. Minimum temperature before compaction of 110C.
— To be delivered into the paver between 140C-175C. Minimum temperature before compaction of 120C.
○ Temperature recorded by Infra-Red Temperature Gun & Probe.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: R116 and Asphalt Laying Procedure. Measure using an infrared thermometer.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mark-out the placement boundary, chainage and required thickness on the surface of the areas
○ Ensure the mark-outs matches drainage inlets including kerb and gutters

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to place asphalt, prepare the surface to a clean, no loose material, defect free and road markers removed, road services and fixtures in vicinity covered, and where required, prime sealed.
○ Sweep to extend 300mm beyond each edge of area to be paved.
7 - Check and record pavement temperature and weather conditions
FREQUENCY: Each lot / 1 check per 2 hours
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: With zero wind speed pavement temperature must above:
○ Add 5oC to above limits for each 5 kph of wind speed above zero
○ Do not place tackcoat and/or asphalt when the pavement surface is wet and/or rain is imminent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Asphalt Placement Record
9 - Construction of temporary ramps / preparation of construction joints
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Set up and prepare the temporary ramps and construction joints for safe access and protection of constructed works
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Apply Tack coat at the nominated rate, and record the rate in the Asphalt Placement Record Sheet
○ The application rate is to be between 0.15-0.3 L/m2, if not otherwise specified
○ Nominate in writing to the RMS rep your proposed tackcoat application rate prior to applying the tackcoat.
○ Reduced application rate for tackcoat is acceptable due to the existing underlying pavement material. Comply with PV first.
○ Report the application rate in terms of residual bitumen and state the percentage dilution of the tackcoat used during spraying
○ Provide to RMS rep a daily record with your endorsement, of the average tackcoat application rate applied to each lot.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Asphalt Placement Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Measure and monitor paving and compaction temperatures and ensure they are not fall below which nominated in item 5.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Asphalt Placement Record
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Longitudinal joints are to be:
— Offset 150mm from the joint of underlying layer, within 150mm of the line of cross fall change
— Located out of wheel paths & in surface layers, coincident with final traffic markings.
— Offset 1m from the joint in the underlying layer
— Formed at the commencement of each paving run
— Formed when a delay in paving causes asphalt temperature to fall below the initial compaction temperature nominated in Clause 3.8..
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All asphalt must be homogenous in appearance. Areas of asphalt that exhibit segregation, cracking, ravelling, bony or fatty material, or damages rectified or replaced.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Immediately after the asphalt has been placed, clean & remove off waste asphalt from affected services and road fixtures
16 - Obtain and verify conformance records including relevant verification sheets
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Check conformance report against conformance criteria:
○ Asphalt placement record with all dockets
○ Field test results – insitu air void, course thickness
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Asphalt Placement Record
17 - Conformance of Levels and Thickness of Pavement
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Level of any course placed meets table R116.9 except where tying in to existing surface where the pavement is to drain surface water and match levels of existing surface.
○ Average thickness of calculated by survey consistent with average thickness calculated from cores except for wearing course which is to be within 10% of design thickness.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: To be submitted progressively
○ Binder content, combined particle size distribution, air voids – within one day of mixing
○ In-situ air voids, course thickness and course shape within 3 days of placing
